data.question: Why was cadmium chosen for the construction of the metal-organic framework?
data.answer: Because of the equatorial-plane locations of its trigonal-bipyramidal coordination geometry, which are easily coordinated by water molecules.

data.question: How does the coordination geometry of cadmium ions contribute to the structure of polymer 1?
data.answer: Each cadmium ion is coordinated by two nitrogen atoms from two different hmt ligands and three coordinated water molecules, contributing to the 3D open framework.

data.question: What is the significance of the large cages in the metal-organic framework?
data.answer: They are suitable for catalyzing reactions of large molecules.

data.question: How does the structure of polymer 1 compare to traditional zeolites?
data.answer: It expands the original structure of MTN and possesses large cages, offering advantages like ion-exchange, adsorption, and catalytic properties.

data.question: What is the role of hexamethylenetetramine in the synthesis of the metal-organic framework?
data.answer: It acts as a ligand with four coordinating N atoms, similar to the SiO4 building block in zeolites.
